intro: Hieracium dissotocoides, commonly known as the clustered hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, featuring hairy stems and basal leaves that are usually lance-shaped. Its flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, blooming from late spring to early autumn. Hieracium dissotocoides is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it can be invasive in certain regions.
